posts.post_content: Swacina is also featured T210 Red Sun card 67, T210-8 Southern Association and the 1914 Baltimore News set. Any info on Swacina is appreciated.
There is no Harry Swacina in the t206 set.

Here are the 7 card issues for Swacina. No T206 issue.  The 1908 Vignette is a postcard and likely a tough find.   He was also included in 2 of the Colgan's Chips sets.

1908 Pittsburgh Pirates Vignette PC800 #NNO Harry Swacina
1910 Old Mill Cigarettes (T210) #NNO Harry Swacina
1910 T211 Red Sun #NNO Harry Swacina
1912 Colgan's Chips Red Borders (E270-1) #NNO Harry Swacina
1913 Colgan's Chips Tin Tops (E270-2) #NNO Harry Swacina 
1914 Baltimore News Baltimore Orioles/Terrapins #NNO Harry Swacina VAR Red
1914 Baltimore News Baltimore Orioles/Terrapins #NNO Harry Swacina VAR Blue

[quote name="Cory" post=2519751]There is no Harry Swacina in the t206 set.[/QUOTE]
He is depicted as a Baltimore player (from the Eastern League, a minor league team), not the Pittsburgh Pirates. This is because the T206 set included both major and minor league players.

The card is labeled "Swacina, Baltimore" and features him in a portrait-style image.

To my knowledge, no such T206 card exists.  Even the Olbermann proofs do not include a Swacina.

From where did you hear about the existence of such a card?

[quote name="Eric72" post=2519770]To my knowledge, no such T206 card exists.  Even the Olbermann proofs do not include a Swacina.

From where did you hear about the existence of such a card?[/QUOTE]

An alphabetical excerpt from the T206 set, per the Standard Catalog:

Harry Swacina was my Grandfather's uncle. I was told that Harry played 1st base for the Pirates in 1907 and 1908. I was told that he played with Honus Wagner during that time
I was also told that he was in the T206 series as well. I got bad intel.....

The T206 folks made a lot of mistakes, including using Harry Hinchman's image for Bud Sharpe's T206 card on the Newark team.  I noticed Swacina also played with Newark.  If only Harry Swacina's image was used instead of Harry Hinchman....
